alert.note: Alert for Haleakala Summit; Kahoolawe; Kipahulu; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Central Valley South; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West; Molokai Southeast; Molokai Windward; South Haleakala; South Maui, Upcountry; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 11:50AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...PERIODS OF HEAVY RAIN OR ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS MAY IMPACT KAHOOLAWE...MAUI AND MOLOKAI IN MAUI COUNTY THROUGH 115 PM HST... At 1143 AM HST, Doppler radar was tracking pockets of moderate rain 12 miles southwest of Makena, or 24 miles south of Kahului, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Periods of rain exceeding one inch per hour could exacerbate localized flooding over recent burn scars in west Maui and on the western slope of Haleakala. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kahului, Kihei, Lahaina, Honokohau, Haliimaile, Kipahulu, Wailuku, Makawao, Paia, Keokea, Wailea, Waihee, Kula, Pukalani, Kapalua, Puunene, Waikapu, Waiehu, Hana, and Makena. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Be aware of localized heavy rainfall leading to nuisance or minor flooding.
